verses.verse: Then answered<WH6030> Eliphaz<WH464> the Temanite,<WH8489> and said,<WH559>
Should a wise<WH2450> man utter<WH6030> vain<WH7307> knowledge,<WH1847> and fill<WH4390> his belly<WH990> with the east wind?<WH6921>
Should he reason<WH3198> with unprofitable<WH3808> <WH5532> talk?<WH1697> or with speeches<WH4405> wherewith he can do no<WH3808> good?<WH3276>
Yea, <WH637> thou<WH859> castest off<WH6565> fear,<WH3374> and restrainest<WH1639> prayer<WH7881> before<WH6440> God.<WH410>
For <WH3588> thy mouth<WH6310> uttereth<WH502> thine iniquity,<WH5771> and thou choosest<WH977> the tongue<WH3956> of the crafty.<WH6175>
Thine own mouth<WH6310> condemneth<WH7561> thee, and not<WH3808> I:<WH589> yea, thine own lips<WH8193> testify<WH6030> against thee.
Art thou the first<WH7223> man<WH120> that was born?<WH3205> or wast thou made<WH2342> before<WH6440> the hills?<WH1389>
Hast thou heard<WH8085> the secret<WH5475> of God?<WH433> and dost thou restrain<WH1639> wisdom<WH2451> to<WH413> thyself?
What <WH4100> knowest<WH3045> thou, that we know<WH3045> not?<WH3808> what understandest<WH995> thou, which<WH1931> is not<WH3808> in<WH5973> us?
With us are both<WH1571> the grayheaded<WH7867> and<WH1571> very aged men,<WH3453> much elder<WH3524> <WH3117> than thy father.<WH4480> <WH1>
Are the consolations<WH8575> of God<WH410> small<WH4592> with<WH4480> thee? is there any secret<WH328> thing<WH1697> with<WH5973> thee?
Why <WH4100> doth thine heart<WH3820> carry thee away?<WH3947> and what<WH4100> do thy eyes<WH5869> wink at,<WH7335>
That <WH3588> thou turnest<WH7725> thy spirit<WH7307> against<WH413> God,<WH410> and lettest such words<WH4405> go out<WH3318> of thy mouth?<WH4480> <WH6310>
What <WH4100> is man,<WH582> that<WH3588> he should be clean?<WH2135> and he which is born<WH3205> of a woman,<WH802> that<WH3588> he should be righteous?<WH6663>
Behold, <WH2005> he putteth no trust<WH539> <WH3808> in his saints;<WH6918> yea, the heavens<WH8064> are not<WH3808> clean<WH2141> in his sight.<WH5869>
How much more<WH637> <WH3588> abominable<WH8581> and filthy<WH444> is man,<WH376> which drinketh<WH8354> iniquity<WH5766> like water?<WH4325>
I will show<WH2331> thee, hear<WH8085> me; and that<WH2088> which I have seen<WH2372> I will declare;<WH5608>
Which <WH834> wise<WH2450> men have told<WH5046> from their fathers,<WH4480> <WH1> and have not<WH3808> hid<WH3582> it:
Unto whom alone<WH905> the earth<WH776> was given,<WH5414> and no<WH3808> stranger<WH2114> passed<WH5674> among<WH8432> them.
The wicked man<WH7563> travaileth with pain<WH2342> all<WH3605> his days,<WH3117> and the number<WH4557> of years<WH8141> is hidden<WH6845> to the oppressor.<WH6184>
A dreadful<WH6343> sound<WH6963> is in his ears:<WH241> in prosperity<WH7965> the destroyer<WH7703> shall come upon<WH935> him.
He believeth<WH539> not<WH3808> that he shall return<WH7725> out of<WH4480> darkness,<WH2822> and he<WH1931> is waited for<WH6822> of<WH413> the sword.<WH2719>
He <WH1931> wandereth abroad<WH5074> for bread,<WH3899> saying, Where<WH346> is it? he knoweth<WH3045> that<WH3588> the day<WH3117> of darkness<WH2822> is ready<WH3559> at his hand.<WH3027>
Trouble <WH6862> and anguish<WH4691> shall make him afraid;<WH1204> they shall prevail against<WH8630> him, as a king<WH4428> ready<WH6264> to the battle.<WH3593>
For <WH3588> he stretcheth out<WH5186> his hand<WH3027> against<WH413> God,<WH410> and strengtheneth himself<WH1396> against<WH413> the Almighty.<WH7706>
He runneth<WH7323> upon<WH413> him, even on his neck,<WH6677> upon the thick<WH5672> bosses<WH1354> of his bucklers: <WH4043>
Because <WH3588> he covereth<WH3680> his face<WH6440> with his fatness,<WH2459> and maketh<WH6213> collops of fat<WH6371> on<WH5921> his flanks.<WH3689>
And he dwelleth in<WH7931> desolate<WH3582> cities,<WH5892> and in houses which<WH1004> no<WH3808> man inhabiteth,<WH3427> which<WH834> are ready<WH6257> to become heaps.<WH1530>
He shall not<WH3808> be rich,<WH6238> neither<WH3808> shall his substance<WH2428> continue,<WH6965> neither<WH3808> shall he prolong<WH5186> the perfection<WH4512> thereof upon the earth.<WH776>

He shall not<WH3808> depart<WH5493> out of<WH4480> darkness;<WH2822> the flame<WH7957> shall dry up<WH3001> his branches,<WH3127> and by the breath<WH7307> of his mouth<WH6310> shall he go away.<WH5493>
Let not<WH408> him that is deceived<WH8582> trust<WH539> in vanity:<WH7723> for<WH3588> vanity<WH7723> shall be<WH1961> his recompense.<WH8545>
It shall be accomplished<WH4390> before<WH3808> his time,<WH3117> and his branch<WH3712> shall not<WH3808> be green.<WH7488>
He shall shake off<WH2554> his unripe grape<WH1154> as the vine,<WH1612> and shall cast off<WH7993> his flower<WH5328> as the olive.<WH2132>
For <WH3588> the congregation<WH5712> of hypocrites<WH2611> shall be desolate,<WH1565> and fire<WH784> shall consume<WH398> the tabernacles<WH168> of bribery.<WH7810>
They conceive<WH2029> mischief,<WH5999> and bring forth<WH3205> vanity,<WH205> and their belly<WH990> prepareth<WH3559> deceit.<WH4820>
